words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt nangk chiə kru.bong.rien
glosses: Susie be doctor and be teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt haj chiə kru.bong.rien
glosses: Susie be doctor and be teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt chiə kru.bong.rien
glosses: Susie be doctor be teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is a teacher.
comment: check of whether juxtaposition is possible

words: Paul mə TV nangk ot ao ropboh.koat
glosses: Paul watch TV and iron shirt his
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.
comment: haj is possible but nangk is better.

words: Paul mə TV haj ot ao ropboh.koat
glosses: Paul watch TV and iron shirt his
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.
comment: haj is possible but nangk is better.

words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt pon.tai nieng chiə ne? kroh
glosses: Susie be doctor but she be PARTICLE poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.

words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt pon.tai nieng ne? kroh
glosses: Susie be doctor but she PARTICLE poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.

words: Jen ban.ting karem pon.tai nieng ban-aoi teuh kon.khmang
glosses: Jen buy ice.cream BUT she give to child
translation: Jen bought ice cream but she gave it to a child.

words: Paul mən men chiə kru.pejt pon.tai koat chiə ne? tu.tua.pniew
glosses: Paul not ? be doctor BUT he be PARTICLE receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Jen mən ban.ting karem pon.tai nieng ban.ting socola
glosses: Jen not buy ice.cream BUT she buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.

words: Cham.laj A reuh cham.laj B
glosses: Answer A OR answer B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.

words: Paul kəchiə krupejt reuh John kəchiə krupejt
glosses: Paul be doctor OR John be doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: Khnjom pləc turosap ropboh khnjom neuh kənlain tveuhkaa reuh khnjom ple? bat tampleuh teuh.phteh khnjom
glosses: I forget phone POSS 1sg at place work OR I fall.down lost on.way home 1sg
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: Khnjom pləc turosap ropboh khnjom neuh kənlain tveuhkaa reuh ple? bat tampleuh teuh.phteh khnjom
glosses: I forget phone POSS 1sg at place work OR fall.down lost on.way home 1sg
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: John kə-chiə krupejt reuh kəchiə ne?-nipôn
glosses: John be doctor OR be writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John kə-chiə krupejt reuh kəchiə ne?nipôn reuh koat cheh peang pij
glosses: John be doctor OR be writer OR he know both two
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).

words: Ta nea? plit turosap ropboh nea? neuh kənlain tveuhkaa reuh nea? plit neuh leuh lan.krong
glosses: Q 2sg forget phone POSS 2sg at place work OR 2sg forget on CLF bus
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?

words: Ta hang A mien luə? p-l-t-poh ma? nih reuh hang B mien luə? p-l-t-poh ma? nih
glosses: Q shop A have sell product brand this OR shop B have sell product brand this
translation: Would Shop A sell this brand or would Shop B sell this brand?

words: Paul m-nmen chi- krupejt haj koh m-nmen chi- kilinopathayikaa dae
glosses: Paul not.be be doctor and also not.be be nurse too
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.

words: Mike m-n ban.ting karem haj ko m-n ban oi.teuh p?on.srj ropboh koat
glosses: Mike not buy ice.cream and also not give to sister POSS his
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Paul ak nham nung-cake reuh koat ak nham cookie
glosses: Paul can eat cupcake OR he can eat cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.

words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt nieng chiə ne? kroh
glosses: Susie be doctor she be PARTICLE poor
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is poor.
comment: juxtaposition example, From A2 contrast context

words: Susie kə-chiə kru.pejt nieng ne? kroh
glosses: Susie be doctor she PARTICLE poor
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is poor.
comment: juxtaposition example, From A2 contrast context

words: Paul kəchiə krupejt John kəchiə krupejt
glosses: Paul be doctor John be doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor; John is a doctor.
